text: Mira Huhta is a Finnish ice hockey defender, currently playing for the Espoo Blues. She was a part of the bronze-medal winning Finnish team at the 2011 IIHF Women's World Championship.https://stats.iihf.com/SIHA/21/IHW0210FIN_83_3_0.pdf == Career == Across 287 games in Finland, Huhta has scored 171 points, winning the championship three times, and being named to the 2017 All-Star Team. She participated in the training camp for the 2018 Winter Olympics, but ultimately failed to make the final roster. == References == ==External links== * Biographical information and career statistics from Elite Prospects Category:Espoo Blues players Category:1987 births Category:Living people Category:People from Helsinki Category:Finnish women's ice hockey defencemen
title: Mira Huhta
